Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2012 07:16PM Renya wrote: I don't understand this "remission" stuff...help please.  Dx last Feb'11/stg4BC - had laser surgery to remove tumor and clean out chest "inside" tissue.  Scans at that time showed mets everywhere..lungs, thyroid, liver, ribs,pelvis and spine, plus basal cell carcinoma on scalp.  Had the basal cell carcinoma removed...but body was a mess.    I refused Chemo or Radiation, have been on nutrtional diet/supplements...Now, last week, Feb 7, 2012, had scan....nothing there???  All mets in body gone, only tiny spot left in my spine,but doc said really, really reduced.   I am on Aromasin & monthly Xgeva shot (had been on Femara & Zometa).   Doc said all looks good and amazed that in only 8 mo's of treatment have made such a clean scan.  I will continue w/program...ERpos.   So, this means nothing and I am still on death watch???  I credit the B17, Fucoidan (which have learned actually eats cancer cells) and other supplements.  I've had 3 friends w/breastcancer, watched them from early stages, surgery, reconstruction, chemo,radiation.  Now, all 3 in the cemetary, can't imagine going thru that, call me a wuss, but sure didn't help them....so, i'm still on death watch???  Doc said all looks good and stop fretting, take each day, hope new discovery will kill the beast before it poses big problem, you say hopeless???  I credit Laser Surgery as it cleans out all the stray cancer cells and seals area and, most importantly, doesn't mutilate the body, no loss of body parts or reconstruction.   So, all this for naught???   What the hell are we fighting for if it's hopeless?
Posts.Title: Stage IV-Can you go into remission, or be cured? amontro Landerson3237

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2012 06:01AM Renya wrote: HI All, I'm confused too, why can't we be told by our doc's diet is extremely important in obtaining good recovery to health.    Yes, I was full of Stg4 mets w/my BCancer, ER/PR pos.   I still opted for the laser surgery as I just didn't like that horrific outlay of surgery oncologist planned for me.  I cried, screamed and went thru kicking the doors, up til wee morning hours searching online for alternative...found it in LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com (please ck it out) - and no, i'm not selling or proporting this for any gain.   I just could not do total mastectomy, all lymph node removal, chemo, radiation, then hey honey, don't worry, we're going to put you back together by slicing part of tummy off and gluing to your chest and make you a new boobie.   Forget it!  Not for me.   I had 5 lymph nodes removed, only 4 were positive, why the heck would they take them all?   I've read since this is an overused, not beneficial practice.   I can only speak for myself, but I know the ability of lasers, which are used in lots of different type surgery, saved me...cleaned out my inside chest wall...sealed the perimiters around breast to keep any cancer cells from getting into my body, and my best benefit - no pain!  I literally walked off the OP table, went to dinner that night, still had my own boobie, slight indentation, but hey, it's mine!  Doc said they got all the tumor, only needed a partial....yet, medical likes to say, w'ere looking out for you, going to take everything...then why do so many of us still have problems later?   I am not trying to be self-righteous, but we all know, when it is a personal experience, we do get a bit agitated when we are yanked around by medical establishment...they tell us we're don't know what's best, seems to me, they don't either.   I've read countless books, educated myself as best I can, still I can't say I know anything close to being well educated in this field, but I do know without a doubt that statistics show cancer has NOT declined in survival rates in over 50 years, only the way stats are reported....and that fries me...doc's will order a 6mo round of chemo, knowing the patient can't tolerate more, then patient still alive after 6 mo's and counted as a cure, then in 8th month they die, but....still counted as a cure....????  You tell me.   All I know is I investigated nutrition, after learning cancer is not a virus, not a bacterial infection, well, what is it????   It's an Anaerobic Disease....and, can't find where any anaerobic disease can be cured with drugs, it's an immune disorder, who the heck knows what the cause is, medical doesn't, they only surmise.   But think 50 years ago we introduced lots of newbies into our life...mircowaves, countless preservatives in food, our water supply questionable, so, and I speak for me, I am not telling anyone what to do, we all have to be our own advocates....but again, "I", after learning I had this "crap" in me, got on purified water, natural/whole foods, 80% fruits/vegs, salmon, No sugars, no gluetemates, no soy (only fermented soy after cancer strikes), no milk products, cancer feeds on mucus.  Why didn't my doctor tell me these things...heck, doc office has candy treats everywhere!   Every day I take 2 Tbsp purred Asparagus-get Green Giant, boil, cool and puree, keep in refrig, every day I take 2 tblsp's AM and PM, you will be surprised how it cleans out body splatter/spot tumors.  I take Curcumin/Tumeric or Curcumin w/Biopriene - Fucoidan or U-FN, Phytoplankton, Calcium, Magnesium, Vitamin C, Indole 3/Carbinol or DIM, D-3, B-12,Zinc, Flaxseed Omega3, CoQ1-. and Iodine.  You need to know amounts to take per how invasive your mets are.   Also,Anyone remember back in 70's the big hype over Laetriele?   Then all of sudden it went quiet???  Pharm co's found they couldn't patent as it was a natural food, so refused to produce and bring to market saying , oh it doesn't work.... Also called Amagdalin.    It can be purchased, I take it, along w/Apricot pit seed (So does Bill Clinton, so i'm not the only proponent).  Also, All my tumor markers fell like lead balloons once I started on the nutrients.  CEA down to 2.1, CA15-3 down to 30, the CA27-29 was stubborn, couldn't get it below 105 for 90 days, then started on the Fucoidan & Phytoplankton, dropped in 30 days to 70!!!    I don't mean to sound dictatoral or "smartypants", again, you asked, and this is MY regimine.   As stated, i've been on only Femara, now Aromasin, formerly Zometa, now Xgeva.  I've had NO chemo/No radiation, My choice.   Last scans, 2/7/12 -doc showed me results, explained...NO METS IN MY BODY, all this in 8 mo's.  Do have the tiny speck in my spine, only lighted area anywhere....so, I'm now exploring Exablate.   I've gotten used to breathing in air and enjoying my family, I will do all I can to save myself, after all, who cares more than me?   Love yourself, you are all important and we do deserve all the benefits available, after all, diet/nutrition cannot hurt, can we say the same for meds and poisons they feed us.  I could see look in my doc's face, he's asking me "What did you say you are taking???"  Yes, many of us survive the drugs, but would we have survived anyway with the right nutrients and treatments ro lessen the severe s/e's?    I'm not saying stop w/treatment, I still believe in medicine....but, we need to feed our body the right foods and give it a little kickstart. We are not all a One Size Fits All!  Sending very sincere wishes of health to you all, we are all holding hands in this battle and we deserve the right to know of the best treatments available. Godspeed.
Posts.Title: Stage IV-Can you go into remission, or be cured? amontro Landerson3237

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2012 06:24AM Renya wrote: Hi Angelfalls...yes it could be the Xgeva/Aromasin that did the trick for me....but, my first scans in Sept were still blotchy, so I started with the nutrients....also, my TMarkers were flat w/Aromasin and Xgeva, then with the Fucoidan/Phytoplankton they dropped like a rock....all I know is something I am taking is working and i'm not going to stop w/the supplements and rely solely on meds to do the trick...especially when I have a 30 yr practicing Oncologist asking me what i'm doing beside prescribed drugs.   I know the body has to be PH alkaline, Aromasin and Xgeva can't do that trick, so I am doing what I can to keep my body well oxygenated to create apoptsis---kill the cancer cells.   Please don't think I am dictating what you or anyone should do, this is what I do, we each have to find our own comfort level to the mental well being of our body as well as the physical, and for me, and for me only, this is my choice and it does seem to be working for me.  I know "things" can go south in a heartbeat, if they do, I will search diligently for further treatment, but I will never submit to this beast.  If it wants me, it is going to have fight like the _itch it is to win, but I won't go down easy.   Best to you, sending cheer and good wishes.
Posts.Title: Stage IV-Can you go into remission, or be cured? amontro Landerson3237

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2012 06:37AM Renya wrote: No, the laser wasn't used on my mets.  I didn't know they were there at the time.   Had only been told I had a tumor in my breast and Onco's scheduled me for total mastectomy/total lymp removal/chemo/rad, then reconstruction.   I could not accept, found Laser, doc there advised I needed to have Pet/CTscan follow ups and get on therapy.   Laser Doc is an MD/ been doing breast surgery for years, but learned new technique to lessen the trauma of breast removal.   It should be available in all hospitals, but the cost is too cheap and wheels of progress, especially in medicine, roll very slowly.    But, I am way ahead of where I would be had I opted for traditional surgery.  I have no mets now, and  I have no complaints, no one can guarantee us freedom of disease, but for me, this was sure an easier path than torturous surgery and rehab.   As for the tiny spot in my spine, I am exploring Exablate, hoping this will zap that spot, continue with what I feel comfortable with and continue with good health.    I am only telling my story, I am not dictating what anyone should do, nor juding anyone's decision, only that we are not given ALL the OPTIONS, nor are we given the right to choose in many instances.   I don't fit that mold, I don't relinquish my life to anyone without investigating the options, if I croak, it will be MY bad choice, and if I continue to thrive, that too will be MY choice.   I wish you all the best, you deserve all the happiness and good health life can bring. I sincerely send only the best of joy and peace,
Posts.Title: Stage IV-Can you go into remission, or be cured? amontro Landerson3237

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2012 05:00PM Renya wrote: Tks for reply, I do get a CA15-3, CA27-29 and CEA marker test....are these the same as the CTC, if not, should I request?   I'm very please with these listed markers as CEA & CA15-3 now at normal, only CA27-29 a bit elevated, now only 72, but is half where started.   Tks.
Posts.Title: Metastataic BrC BloodTest/Survival Predictor Renya bestfriend05

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2012 03:51PM Renya wrote: Hi Raro....Gee, would think they would repeat test - and not charge you since the lab at fault.   Know we want all the info available, tho I have no idea really what many tests indicate.  I just want so desperately to hear "remission", I was so confused, thought when they told me NED with the mets, that was like remission.....so, I'm high one minute, down the next, but guess still better than active mets... still lighted area in spine, so I wonder what any of this means?  I go to bed worried it's growing while I sleep and will be exploding inside me all over.   Hate this sport, not fun, no rules, no idea how to read the scoreboard....So anyone who has info on NED vs. Remission...post please.   Also, raro, so uplifting to see how long you've punched this junkie stuff and winning....you deserve a big hand of applause, you've giving me lots of hope.  Doc thinks i've had 2 yrs prior to DX, due to the Stg4 & basal cell carcinoma, so only been on meds since June 11.   So makes me a 3 yr winner to date.    Thanks to all, love the posts and support.   Sending prayer, good wishes and cheer to all....
Posts.Title: Metastataic BrC BloodTest/Survival Predictor Renya bestfriend05

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2013 08:05PM Renya wrote: Take it from a fellow Stage 4 BC fighter - Nothing is ever hopeless, we, doc's, our fellow survivors, those we've lost, none know for certain if or when we will be at the end of our journey.   I had a pretty grim dx....at Stg 4, since there is no Stg5, fairly easy to understand what a dead end means...but - I was told i'd be singing with the angels in November of 2011 - it's now March, 2013, just had tumor markers run and they are (all 3) normal, well, under normal!   No mets to thryroid, lungs, liver, ribs or spine, just tiny diminishing spot in my spine which I feel I can erase as well.  Also, had basal cell carcinoma removed from my scalp where mets had taken residence.   What a beastly disease.  I am on Aromasin, switched from Femara when the joint pain and misery just got too unbearable - even percocet couldn't calm the pain.  I am also still on Xgeva to strengthen bone.   I am determined to beat this nasty uninvited invader; so far, i'm ahead.  My doc is very pleased, said he'd never have imagined I could be this "clean" from where I was.   All this due to a misread mammogram, but, what good is screaming and beating the feathers out of someone, i'll still be Stage4, so after I had my hissy fits, yelled at top of my lungs, kicked a few walls, threw a few dishes, i've calmed down.....a little.  I've watched 2 close friends, one dx'd same time as me, she died last April.   I did have laser surgery to remove the tumor, know it went long way to clean me up.  I'd read the tumor is like a "mother ship" spreading "crap" (yep, that's a better word that I what I usually use) into the body.   And, now for the laugh of the day, I tried all those natural cures, why not?  They cannot hurt and I just believe they did help.   Google bakingsoda/maplesyrupcancercure.  I did that for 30 days and that's when my mets started disappearing.  I am doing very well, lots of energy, all bloodwork, stats, TM's, etc. are perfect, so if I can do it, anyone can.   I have DCIS, I know BC comes in lots of different packages, I just started studies on my particular cancer type, did all I could to learn and fight back.   Know your enemy, that's the only way you can fight to win. Inflammatory and Triple Neg are the worst, but no matter what they call our particular type, it's the worst when WE have it, or a loved one.  We lost our son to Lung Cancer ten years ago, I was really angry, seems strange I'm not angry now that I am the one bitten, but something is telling me I am going to survive this demon, I am determined...I wish you all the best, all sticken know the fight goes on every millisecond of every day, never give up.
Posts.Title: is this hopeless? manysunshine Chickadee

Posts.Content: Renya wrote: Just read article re Met/BC Survial predictor...Called a CTC test (Circulating Tumor Cell) bloodtest.  Is anyone getting this along w/bloodwork???  News to me, If interested, go to site, would love to hear from anyone with experience, what you've been advised.   www.sciencedaily.com/releases2010/05/1005061126012601.htm    It can ge googled on own .  I found going to CTC Blood Test and looking for the link.   If anyone familiar w/this test,please post.    I am Stg4, recently recvd my last scan reports "no mets in body", now down to tiny spot in spine.   Also, has anyone else been told no sign of mets in pelvis, ribs after Dx, I thought once in the bone, always in the bone, but doc showed me scans, not that I can understand, but didn't see the former spots.   Good luck all. Posts.Title: Metastataic BrC BloodTest/Survival Predictor Renya bestfriend05

Posts.Content: May 14, 2012 12:31AM Renya wrote: I too am Stg4 BC & hell yes i'm angry too....especially since my situation due to a misread mammogram - recvd an all clear, then 14 mo's later Dx'd Stage 4! I'm angry because I had to pay for this mammogram, no one ever said, oh, we're so sorry, they just smiled and said, we'll take good care of you. AHHHH...think you've done enough, thank you.    Not even the joy of going thru Stage 1 - 2 -3 -What the hay???  Well, i'm into this now for 17 mo's.   I had LaserSurgery, another great service kept under wraps by our "intelligent" medical community.   Was able to take out the tumor and clean out my chest wall, plus take only 4 lymph nodes and bypass danger of lymphodema - which medical again says, "quite rare", but can happen?   I have over 40 cancer books, studied, read, re-read.   Can't get a X%$& straight answer from an oncologist, maybe they just don't know....but at the beginning of this journey, after my MRI/PET/CT/BONE scans, it was doomsday, mets everywhere: Liver, lungs, ribs, pelvis L&R, spine, plus a basal cell carcinoma on my scalp which I had excised.   If not for the tumor which came up on my chest ---which I was told was a fatty tumor--i'd still be sitting around wonder if I should or should not have it removed....I did, that's when they found it was full of cancer cells.   Now, I have managed to rid my body of all tumors/splatters/spots in all soft tissue, nothing left anywhere, only spot left in my spine.   I've learned lots about diet and damn it, it does work.   Notice how doc offices full of candy????   Hell, that's engine fuel for cancer.  Cancer lives/thrives on simple sugars!  I have been on nutrients, diet excluding milk which creates mucos for cancer, no glutemates, no soy, right---no soy once you have cancer, only fermented.   I know, my doc laughed at me for the first 4 mo's, then my tumor markers fell like a lead balloon from over the moon to normal, scans clear, then he's asking me "Tell me again, what are you doing?"   My question to medical - What the hell are you doing?   I'm now investigating Cesium Chloride - it is a proven remedy to get cancer out of bone, very detailed procedure, also know BIG FAT PHARMA will sic the FDA (FRAUD DEATH ASSOC) on me, but i'm smart enough to leave the country to have this done.  At present I am doing great, no problems, allblood work is perfect, no aches/pains.   I have had NO CHEMO - NO RADIATION.   Crap stuff is heavy metals and that is what destroys the immune system; plus they tell you at Stage 4, nothing we can do for you, go home and die....yes, they told me that.   Screw you Mr. Onco, i'll die when I get good and damn ready.   I am not telling anyone what they should do, only what I am doing and what is working for me.   I feel great, I am heallthy, all scans greatly improved, TM's normal....I know it can change, but I could get hit by a falling tree (I live in the woods-so yes, it could happen). I don't thrive on anger, but I enjoy a good scream every once in awhile, for the most part i've changed nothing in my life, i've put all negativity behind me and i'm charting my own course.   I take many nutrients/supplements and a very healthy diet and yes, it is working for me.  Example Tamoxifin - well, I take Indole3/Carbinol.   The molecular makeup is identical, the only difference is Tamoxifin has the added poisons of chemo added.   I take the pure version.  Fucoidan, Bitter Melon, all these now being studied by Sloan Kettering, they realize there is something beneficial for longevity in Cancer patients.....many others, so stay strong and don't let anyone yank your chain, be your own best advocate, I know doctors don't believe it, but they don't know everything, sadly what they do know, they are not allowed to act on, BIG PHARMA standing in the wings with a loaded eradicator!
Posts.Title: No, you don't understand... Stormynyte Reneepals
